c74object.name: sp.corpussampler~
c74object.digest: Find the nearest match in a pre-analyzed corpus
c74object.description: Find the nearest match in a pre-analyzed corpus.
c74object.discussion: Open the Overview Patch The sp.corpussampler~ object is an all-in-one corpus descriptor analysis and corpus playback object that combines the functionality of sp.descriptors, sp.corpusmatch, and sp.corpusplayer.

inlet.description: Primary input for onset detection and recording. Different input modes can apply filtering based on the type of input being used.
Audio input for recording independently of onset detection when being used in different input modes.

outlet.description: Audio output (right). The right outlet will be the same as the left outlet if the entry in the corpus is mono. It will only play back in true stereo when the source file is in stereo.
Analyzed onset as a trigger, time-aligned with descriptor analysis.
Analyzed onset as a gate, time-aligned with descriptor analysis.

objarg.name: default
objarg.digest: JSON file to load by default
objarg.description: JSON file to load by default.

objarg.name: setup
objarg.digest: Setup JSON file to load by default
objarg.description: Setup JSON file to load by default.

method.name: corpus
method.description: Messages related to corpus matching. After sending the corpus message you send an argument of 'match' followed by a time-scale you wish to match against. The available options are: short = the first 256 samples (at 44.1k sample rate) medium = the first 4410 samples (at 44.1k sample rate) all = the entire file Therefore a complete message would look as follows: 'corpus match all' or 'corpus match small'

method.name: filter
method.description: Messages related to corpus filtering. After sending the filter message you send a series of additional arguments that determine what descriptor is being filtered, how it is being filtered, as well as further filtering strands combined with conditionals. The available descriptors that can be used for filtering are: duration = overall sample duration in ms time_centroid = how long a sample 'sounds' in ms loudness = loudness in dB centroid = centroid in MIDI pitch flatness = spectral flatness in dB pitch = pitch in MIDI pitch pitch_confidence = pitch confidence in 0 to 1 loudness_medium = same for medium time frame centroid_medium = same for medium time frame flatness_medium = same for medium time frame pitch_medium = same for medium time frame pitch_confidence_medium = same for medium time frame loudness_all = same for entire sample centroid_all = same for entire sample flatness_all = same for entire sample pitch_all = same for entire sample pitch_confidence_all = same for entire sample index = the sample index in the corpus You can filter by the following operators: == = equals != = does not equal < = less than <= = less than or equal > = greater than >= = greater than or equal You can join multiple queries using: and or Therefore a complete message would look as follows: 'filter loudness < -45' or 'filter duration > 2500' or 'filter centroid > 60 and time_centroid < 80' To reset the filtering you can send the following message: 'filter reset'

method.name: info
method.digest: Print corpus metatdata/info to Max console
method.description: Prints a summary of the corpus metatdata/info to the Max console.

method.name: jump
method.digest: Jump to that position in the last played sample
method.description: Jump to that position in the last played sample (0.0 to 1.0).

method.name: load
method.description: Opens file dialog to select pre-trained corpus .json file.

method.name: print
method.digest: Print dataset contents to Max console
method.description: Prints a summary of the descriptors in the dataset to the Max console.

method.name: read
method.description: Reads a pre-trained corpus .json file directly from a relative or absolute path.

method.name: setup
method.description: Messages related to setups. After sending the setup message you can send send several additional arguments. These are: load = opens file dialog to select pre-analyzed setup .json file. read = reads a pre-analyzed setup .json file from a relative or absolute path match = enables or disables the setup matching by sending a 0 or 1 range = sets the median and range for the internal standardization. this consists of two values between 0-100 with the default being 25 75 Therefore a complete message would look as follows: 'setup range 10 90' or 'setup match 1' or 'setup read setup_snare.json'

attribute.name: buffer
attribute.digest: Polybuffer name to use
attribute.description: Polybuffer name to take when being used for non-corpus playback.

attribute.name: fastrampdown
attribute.digest: The number of samples the relative envelope follower will take to reach the next value when falling
attribute.description: The number of samples the relative envelope follower will take to reach the next value when falling. Typically, this will be faster than slowrampdown.

attribute.name: fastrampup
attribute.digest: The number of samples the relative envelope follower will take to reach the next value when raising
attribute.description: The number of samples the relative envelope follower will take to reach the next value when raising. Typically, this will be faster than slowrampup.

attribute.name: fftsettings
attribute.digest: FFT settings for analysis
attribute.description: FFT settings consist of three numbers representing the window size, hop size and FFT size in samples: The hop size and fft size can both be set to -1 (and are by default), with slightly different meanings: For the hop size, -1 = windowsize/2 For the FFT size, -1 = windowsize snapped to the nearest equal / greater power of 2 (e.g. windowsize 1024 => fftsize 1024, but windowssize 1000 also => fftsize 1024) Constraints FFTSize, if != -1, will snap to the next greatest power of two if FFT size != -1, then window size is clipped at FFT size

attribute.name: floor
attribute.digest: The level in dB the slow ramp needs to be above to consider a detected difference valid, allowing to ignore the onsets in the noise floor
attribute.description: The level in dB the slow ramp needs to be above to consider a detected difference valid, allowing to ignore the onsets in the noise floor.

attribute.name: highpassfreq
attribute.digest: The frequency of the fourth-order high-pass filter. This is done first on the signal to minimise low frequency intermodulation with very fast ramp lengths.
attribute.description: The frequency of the fourth-order Linkwitzâ€“Riley high-pass filter (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linkwitz%E2%80%93Riley_filter). This is done first on the signal to minimise low frequency intermodulation with very fast ramp lengths. A frequency of 0 bypasses the filter.

attribute.name: in
attribute.digest: Fade in amount
attribute.description: Fade in amount (0-100%).

attribute.name: incurve
attribute.digest: Curve for attack fade in
attribute.description: Curve for attack fade in (0% = linear, -100% = exponential, 100% = logarithmic).

attribute.name: input
attribute.digest: Sets the input mode (air microphone, SP Sensor, contact/trigger)
attribute.description: Sets the input mode allowing you to use an air microphone, a Sensory Percussion sensor, or a normal drum trigger/contact mic. When using input modes 3/4, the SP sensor and contact mic are only used for onset detection, and the air microphone will be recorded into the buffer~ for audio analysis. The available options are: 0 = primary input (onset and recording) 1 = SP sensor in primary input (onset and recording) 2 = contact mic in primary input (onset and recording) 3 = SP sensor + air microphone (secondary input) 4 = contact mic + air microphone (secondary input) 5 = SP sensor with mic correction

attribute.name: length
attribute.digest: Sample length to play
attribute.description: Sample length to play (0-100%).

attribute.name: lengthabsolute
attribute.digest: Sample length to play (in ms)
attribute.description: Sample length to play (in ms). This will be compared to the relative length and the lesser of the two will be taken as the actual length.

attribute.name: lockout
attribute.digest: Amount of time (in ms) before it can get triggered again
attribute.description: Amount of time (in ms) before an onset can get triggered again.

attribute.name: loop
attribute.digest: Enables looping of playback
attribute.description: Enables looping of playback. The loop parameter applies globally so if you have sp.corpusplayer~ set to 16 voices (the default) you can quickly end up with a chaotic and polymetric loop.

attribute.name: loudness
attribute.digest: Amount of loudness compensation to apply
attribute.description: Amount of loudness compensation to apply (bewteen -100 and 100%).

attribute.name: metric
attribute.digest: The metric on which spectral difference is computed
attribute.description: The metric used to derive a difference curve between spectral frames. It can be any of the following: 0 = '0' Energy thresholds on (sum of squares of magnitudes / nBins) (like Onsets power) 1 = '1' HFC thresholds on (sum of (squared magnitudes * binNum) / nBins) 2 = '2' SpectralFlux thresholds on (difference in magnitude between consecutive frames, half rectified) 3 = '3' MKL thresholds on (sum of log of magnitude ratio per bin) (or equivalently, sum of difference of the log magnitude per bin) (like Onsets mkl) 4 = '4' IS (WILL PROBABLY BE REMOVED) Itakura - Saito divergence (see literature) 5 = '5' Cosine thresholds on (cosine distance between comparison frames) 6 = '6' PhaseDev takes the past 2 frames, projects to the current, as anticipated if it was a steady state, then compute the sum of the differences, on which it thresholds (like Onsets phase) 7 = '7' WPhaseDev same as PhaseDev, but weighted by the magnitude in order to remove chaos noise floor (like Onsets wphase) 8 = '8' ComplexDev same as PhaseDev, but in the complex domain - the anticipated amp is considered steady, and the phase is projected, then a complex subtraction is done with the actual present frame. The sum of magnitudes is used to threshold (like Onsets complex) 9 = '9' RComplexDev same as above, but rectified (like Onsets rcomplex)

attribute.name: minslicelength
attribute.digest: The length in samples that the slice will stay ON
attribute.description: The length in samples that the Slice will stay ON. Changes of states during that period will be ignored. This is the equivalent of lockout but set in samples.

attribute.name: mode
attribute.digest: Select between amplitude or spectral onset detection algorithms
attribute.description: Select between amplitude or spectral onset detection algorithms.

attribute.name: offthreshold
attribute.digest: The threshold in dB of the relative envelope follower to reset, aka to allow the differential envelope to trigger again.
attribute.description: The threshold in dB of the relative envelope follower to reset, aka to allow the differential envelope to trigger again.

attribute.name: onthreshold
attribute.digest: The threshold in dB of the relative envelope follower to trigger an onset, aka to go ON when in OFF state
attribute.description: The threshold in dB of the relative envelope follower to trigger an onset, aka to go ON when in OFF state. It is computed on the difference between the two envelope followers.

attribute.name: out
attribute.digest: Fade out amount
attribute.description: Fade out amount (0-100%).

attribute.name: outcurve
attribute.digest: Curve for attack fade out
attribute.description: Curve for fade out (0% = linear, -100% = logarithmic, 100% = exponential).

attribute.name: pitch
attribute.digest: Amount of half steps to transpose up or down (when in timestretch mode)
attribute.description: Amount of half steps to transpose up or down (when in timestretch mode) (-24-24).

attribute.name: sensitivity
attribute.digest: The nervousness of the algorithm thresholds (from 0 to 100%)
attribute.description: The nervousness of the algorithm thresholds (from 0 to 100%). This is essentially a 'macro' parameter for the individual on/off thresholds.

attribute.name: slowrampdown
attribute.digest: The number of samples the absolute envelope follower will take to reach the next value when falling.
attribute.description: The number of samples the absolute envelope follower will take to reach the next value when falling.

attribute.name: slowrampup
attribute.digest: The number of samples the absolute envelope follower will take to reach the next value when raising.
attribute.description: The number of samples the absolute envelope follower will take to reach the next value when raising.

attribute.name: smoothing
attribute.digest: The size of the smoothing filter applied to the difference curve
attribute.description: The size of the smoothing filter applied to the difference curve when in spectral mode.

attribute.name: spectral
attribute.digest: Amount of spectral compensation to apply
attribute.description: Amount of spectral compensation to apply (bewteen -100 and 100%).

attribute.name: speed
attribute.digest: Playback speed
attribute.description: Playback speed (-1000 to 1000%).

attribute.name: start
attribute.digest: Sample start offset
attribute.description: Sample start offset (0-50%).

attribute.name: startabsolute
attribute.digest: Sample start offset (in ms)
attribute.description: Sample start offset (in ms). This will be added to the relative offset to combine the two.

attribute.name: steal
attribute.digest: Whether poly voice stealing is enabled
attribute.description: Sets whether voice stealing is enabled, which allows new samples to start when previous ones are still sounding.

attribute.name: timestretch
attribute.digest: Enables timestretch mode
attribute.description: Enables timestretch mode.

attribute.name: timestretchmode
attribute.digest: Timestretch algorithm to use
attribute.description: Timestretch algorithm to use (basic, monophonic, rhythmic, general, extremestretch, efficient).

attribute.name: voices
attribute.digest: Amount of polyphony
attribute.description: Sets the amount of polyphony available for sample playback.

attribute.name: window
attribute.digest: Window of time to look for spectral difference in (for HFC, SpectralFlux, MKL, Cosine only)
attribute.description: Window of time to look for spectral difference in when in spectral mode (for HFC, SpectralFlux, MKL, Cosine only). (in ms)
